title: U.S. Army Private Faces Terrorism Charges Over Alleged ISIS Support
sub_head: Private First Class Cole James Bridges provided military advice to an undercover agent posing as a jihadist, authorities say
body:
Federal authorities Tuesday unsealed terrorism charges against a 20-year-old U.S. Army cavalry scout based in Fort Stewart, Ga., who allegedly sympathized with Islamic State in Syria and provided tactical military advice to an undercover federal agent posing as a jihadist.
The Manhattan U.S. attorney’s office said the defendant, Private First Class Cole James Bridges, joined the Army in 2019 harboring hatred for his country and admiration for Islamic State and its goal of a world-wide caliphate.
The Federal Bureau of Investigation said in his online communications Pfc. Bridges described himself as “opposed to certain methods used by ISIS” but was happy to offer lessons from his combat training, including how best to defend a compound from a special forces raid.
Pfc. Bridges, a native of Stow, Ohio, was charged with attempting to give support to a terrorist organization and attempted murder of U.S. military service members. The Federal Bureau of Investigation and Army Counterintelligence arrested Pfc. Bridges on Tuesday. He will make his first court appearance in federal court in Georgia on Thursday.
A lawyer for Pfc. Bridges couldn’t immediately be identified.
